title: Null (mathematics)
summary: In mathematics, the word null (from German: null meaning "zero", which is from Latin: nullus meaning "none") is often associated with the concept of zero or the concept of nothing.[1][2] It is used in varying context from "having zero members in a set" (e.g., null set)[3] to "having a value of zero" (e.g., null vector).[4]
